data.title: No available method of controlling map exploration using Lua.
data.body: While working on a map I have found that there are no methods of controlling map vision using Lua. I suggest that some new Lua functions be implemented such as "Player.Explore(CPos[] cells)", "Player.ExploreAll()", "Player.Enshroud(CPos[] cells)" and "Player.EnshroudAll()" to give greater control over the vision of players to map/mission scripters.

data.title: template 69 in cnc's snow.yaml and jungle.yaml is of size 1,1 but contains 3 tiles
data.body:
I bumped into this while working on the map generator. Take a look at the template in jungle.yaml:

``` yaml
    Template@69:
        Id: 69
        Images: p03.jun
        Size: 1,1
        PickAny: True
        Category: Debris
        Tiles:
            0: Wall
            1: Clear
            2: Clear
```

Size 1,1 but has 3 tiles? Seems wrong. Other tilesets whichs use the 69 template like temperat.yaml and desert.yaml each only define one tile. This caused a weird bug while working on my map generator. Placing these tiles with the generator caused completely black tiles to be added to the map. My current workaround is to just not place these tiles while adding debris.

data.title: Lua Scripted WeatherOverlay Commands
data.body: It would be nice if you can control the WeatherOverlay trait through Lua. You can already control the Lighting with Lua.

data.title: Remove RA:Aftermath assets from repo and installer.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
#11375 finally gave us the framework we need to manage expansion asset management and installation.

We can now:
- Remove these files from our repo (and installers).
- Add a new required "Aftermath assets" package in the content metadata and set up the disc install metadata.
- Host a new zip on our mirrors with these assets.
- Host a new zip on our mirrors with the base ra + aftermath content for the quick install option.
- While we're at it, host new packages for the base assets and music to replace our current hacked versions.

Solves my #11527 (thanks for help @Phrohdoh :tada: )
Split into 2 commits. Fair warning, if we use only first commit, the cursor will be at the start of the field in front of the password.

data.title: [RA] Rebalance russia faction / tesla weaponry
data.body:
It seems there is some [agreement](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19579&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0) that shockies are still a little OP for their price. There have been a number of varying suggestions from the community (accreditations might be off or a little inaccurate, I apologize) on how to fix them so I tried a bunch of them together (tweaked) and the results seem to gel pretty good.
- Damage vs infantry reduced (Suggested by AoAGeneral)
- Damage vs everything else reduced (Suggested by klaas, SoScared) by ~20%
- HP reduced (Suggested by Murto, SoScared) by 20%
- Slight fire delay

These stats sound extreme but in reality it means
- Medics, tanyas and mechs are no longer one shotted
- Shockies now pause before firing for about the same time as a flametrooper
- They are a little more fragile and a little less melty

To make up for that, I buffed the TT a little
- Now has a 2 shot burst (suggested by FiveAces)
- Slight fire delay

Which means
- Now takes slightly longer than a shock trooper to fire
- Can now finish off two very low health targets per burst or two full health infantry

Finally all tesla weaponry damage vs walls has been reduced to 50% (suggested by SoScared)

data.title: Set explored map as the default lobby option for all mods

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
This seems to be how the majority of players in TD and recently [RA](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19611) wish to play on-line. Aside from the points raised about helping new players, I have found this actually removes _a lot_ of frustration out of playing early game in general, so I just set it for all mods.
- Eliminates units refusing to move if you click on impassable terrain under the shroud. Also eliminates having to shift click spam a black screen to get around this. 
- If playing random spawns, you no longer have to pan the screen in four different directions to figure out where the map border is (and hence your spawn position)
- No more memorizing a map for REF placement, tech buildings, debris / ore in the spawn blocking building placement etc. No more shift click spamming scouts just to uncover the map - now you can focus on scouting the enemy and countering their scouts.
- No longer at a disadvantage on new maps so you can focus on just playing. Much less frustrating to try different tactics like changing your initial MCV deployment and rushes.

data.title: Delete legacy downloaded scores.mix on first run
data.body:
The asset download ships a mangled scores.mix that only has Hell March.  This causes problems for the music player (#11375 ripped out the special place hacks it used to have) and content manager.

This implements a new "Migrations" block that, for now, lets us match files based on name and length and delete them.  I have implemented this in a general enough way that we can expand it later as needs arise for moving content, migrating maps to newer releases, cleaning up older content (replays, maps – with a confirmation prompt), etc.

Closes #11525.

data.title: Some user-friendliness polish - Password required dialog
data.body:
1) Could we jump right into the text field so we don't have to click and then type?
2) On wrong password, could it happen too, plus possibly delete the wrong password from text field?

:^)

data.title: Remove legacy Move constructor.
Add a "Migrations" metadata block for deleting old files when loading a mod.

data.title: Support content installation from "C&C The Ultimate Collection" (Origin versions).
data.body:
This adds support for querying the Windows registry to find an install location that is used as an asset source, and then tweaks the content and installation UI to distinguish between external and internal media.

TD, RA, and TS have been updated to support installation fro TUC.  This required a few minor tweaks to the file layout, which we will be able to clean up as part of the future file-migrations PR.

I have [another branch](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/gruntmods) that adds support for installing D2K assets from the gruntmods edition, but that's blocked on #2344.

data.title: Group of helis failing to follow a route (stucked)
data.body:
When a group of helis are given a route to follow (shift+move), only 1 or 2 of them manage to continue the route. 
The others get stucked on the first waypoint.

data.title: Make civilians wander around when idle
data.body: Via new `IdleWander` trait.

data.title: Avoid importing spawn points with the same location
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8115.

You can use http://ra.afraid.org/maps/index.php?size=&theater=&players=&rules=&trigs=&units=&name=stalingrad&author=&sort_by=name&order=asc as a test case which has one duplicated player spawn location.

data.title: Convert HackyAI BuildingFractions and UnitsToBuild to int percentages
data.body:
As far as I can tell, this is the last simulation-related place in our engine still using `float`.
For consistency and accuracy, we should use integer percentages here, too.

All mods except RA were upgraded with the provided upgrade rule.

data.title: OpenRA Red Alert mode slowing down, than Fatal Error

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
At first let me mention I really find your team work really awesome to get these old games running again. Spent a lot of hours when I was young and now again on these great games!!!

I was playing RA skirmish against four enemies (all four classes) and winning big time by being tactical ofcourse ;) Suddenly the game slowed down and that went on for about 20 minutes after the game crashed with a Fatal Error (bummer, all my nice work for nothing).

Could this be a OpenRA bug or just a system issue (running Windows 10 with 8GB and AMD Radeon 6950)?

Exception log:

> Red Alert Mod at Version release-20160508
> on map 3af3d6e6a39a4e020fb601ef8cac7742a929f553 (Blitzkrieg by s1w).
> Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
> Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
> Exception of type `System.OverflowException`: Negating the minimum value of a twos complement number is invalid.
>    at System.Math.AbsHelper(Int32 value)
>    at OpenRA.WAngle.ArcTan(Int32 y, Int32 x, Int32 stride)
>    at OpenRA.WVec.get_Yaw()
>    at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Turreted.FaceTarget(Actor self, Target target)
>    at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackTurreted.CanAttack(Actor self, Target target)
>    at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackBase.DoAttack(Actor self, Target target, IEnumerable`1 armaments)
>    at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackFollow.Tick(Actor self)
>    at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__3(TraitPair`1 x)
>    at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[T](IEnumerable`1 e, Action`1 a, String text)
>    at OpenRA.World.Tick()
>    at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
>    at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
>    at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
>    at OpenRA.Game.Run()
>    at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
>    at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

Second issue, but less important: sometimes loosing my cursor. After moving it few times around, it shows up again.

Debug log:
Failed to initialize hardware cursors. Falling back to software cursors.
Error was: Failed to create hardware cursor `guard-minimap` - Failed to create cursor: CreateIconIndirect(): The parameter is incorrect.

data.title: Fix Wanders always triggering move at first game tick
data.body:
Currently, all actors with `AttackWander` or some other `Wanders`-derivative wander at the first tick because `countdown` has not yet been set to a random value when the first `TickIdle` runs.

I added a `firstTick` check so `TickIdle` won't do anything before the 2nd tick, ensuring `countdown` has been set properly by that time.

Additionally made `TickIdle` virtual so traits like `AttackWander` can override it, if necessary.

data.title: Fix a crash with not space occupying actors granting support powers
data.body: Fixes #11509.

data.title: Remove passing the warheads from DamageWarhead to AttackInfo.
data.body:
Added an IDamage wrapper interface and a DamageObject implementation to pass damage(types) instead.
This removes a great amount of overhead and longterm opens possibilities to have damagetypes without warheads.

data.title: Added Squad Exclusion to HackyAI
data.body:
Thanks to GraionDilach for pointing this out to me but HackyAI will exclude MCVs and harvesters from squads but otherwise will add any available units to squads including possibility unarmed utility units like the Manticore faction in my mod, Phoenix Chronicles, has. So I have an AI that will send power-generating unarmed trucks and it's HQ among other base-units into battle. This gives a modder a way to make units with the sole purpose of being around the base. Could be useful for the mobile repair vehicle for Nod in TS.

No test case included, but I did test it before pushing by adding like 90% of the unit roster to the exclusion list. Nothing included appeared to be put into a squad.

data.title: D2k: Add Cliffmaze 1v1 map by S.D.
data.body:
![cliffmaze](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8225171/16298845/406bc3e0-392f-11e6-946d-080d01c38f57.png)

This is a small 1v1 map with a maze-like cliff layout between bases. Lots of sand dunes make infantry very useful, and the short distance between bases should make for a very intense tug of war.

I merely fixed some tile issues, so if there are any then let me know. SD gave permission for this to be included in ORA.
